title: Quiz 2: Types of Research
description: Qualitative vs Quantitative, Basic vs Applied, and Time Dimensions.

questions.question: Which research type focuses on 'understanding people's interpretations and perceptions' using words?
questions.explanation: Qualitative research uses words to understand interpretations and perceptions.
questions.hint: Think about which type uses narrative data.

questions.question: Match the classification to the research type.

pairs.right: Data collected over a long period
Data collected at one point in time

questions.explanation: Basic is theoretical, Applied is practical, Longitudinal is over time, Cross-sectional is at one time.
questions.hint: Consider the purpose and timing of each research type.

questions.question: Quantitative research uses inductive reasoning, whereas Qualitative research uses deductive reasoning.
questions.explanation: Quantitative uses Deductive; Qualitative uses Inductive.
questions.hint: Quantitative starts with hypothesis; Qualitative builds theory from data.

questions.question: Which of the following are types of Qualitative Research? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Historical, Case Study, and RRA are qualitative. RCT is quantitative.
questions.hint: Focus on methods that use non-numerical data.

questions.question: A ___BLANK___ study involves following the same group of people over various periods of time.
questions.explanation: A Panel study follows the same group over time.
questions.hint: Think about studying the same people repeatedly.

questions.question: Which RRA tool involves drawing circles to indicate relationships and importance of institutions?
questions.explanation: Venn Diagrams show relationships and importance using circles.
questions.hint: Think about visual tools that use overlapping circles.

questions.question: What is the defining feature of 'Experimental Research'?

options.text: It observes phenomena as they naturally occur
It manipulates independent variables to determine effects

questions.explanation: Experimental research manipulates variables to determine cause and effect.

questions.question: A Cohort study treats a group of individuals with similar characteristics as one unit for research purposes.
questions.explanation: Cohort studies follow groups with similar characteristics.
questions.hint: Cohort means a group with shared characteristics.

questions.question: What type of study looks back in time to link present outcomes with past exposures?
questions.hint: Think about looking back in time.

questions.question: Which of the following are limitations of Case Studies? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Case studies lack statistical validation, are susceptible to bias, and are time-consuming.
questions.hint: Consider the challenges of studying single cases in depth.
